title: American_Top_40_1982_December_18th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.
In this broadcast:

Bob Seger & The Silver Bullet Band debut in the hot 100 with their first hit song in a year; all the way up at number 40!

A listener writes in to ask, "Have there ever been any number one songs whose titles are not mentioned in the song's lyrics?" Casey says out of 600 number one hits in the rock era, there have been only five.

Casey tells about the only group in chart history to have five number one hits in a row, and they did in less than a year.

Casey tells the origins of the expressions, "A Penny For Your Thoughts," and "Goody Two Shoes."

Casey also explains Vegemite.
